subject: Home At Last
event:
Back in Santa Fe again.

And tomorrow, back in Westeros.

The road goes ever on and on ... but there's no place like home.

comments.article:
Welcome home ♥ Wish that I could've attended some of the events in Minnesota. I hope your journeys bring you close to Georgia someday :)

TEAM JON, btw ^__~

comments.upictitle: Proud to be a geek.  Proud to be a gentleman.: data-wtf
comments.article: Fair travels, George!  We shall walk with you and perhaps lighten your load.

Welcome back :)

You made my night with your "The road goes ever on and on" quote. It touched some place inside of me that made me feel happy. Thank you :)

Two things - one, go and catch up on Giants-Jets games. I'm dying to hear your thoughts on the season so far.

Two...well, two is obvious. Once you leave the Meadowlands, it's off to Westeros!
comments.subject: Welcome home!

comments.article: Since you are home, did you know about the Mountain That Rides moving into the semifinals of the Suvudu Cage Match Villians Match? I know you rooted for Jaime last time, I think The Mountain has an even better chance at this one.
comments.subject: Suvudu Cage Match

comments.upictitle: Len Brown: Goblins Comic Complains Of Names
comments.article: Not Only is he in the Semi's He's got a huge lead over the T-800. I think the Mountain will Ride into the Finals to face either Glory or the Reaper.
comments.subject: Re: Suvudu Cage Match

comments.article:
It was great getting a chance to meet you. It was great that you could be in MN for more than 3 days! Loved listening to you and Melinda and the other author, I forget his name, being very yourselves, and talking about Wild Cards. Which now Ive picked up. Ive been skeptical till I heard it from you guys.

It was quite funny that Winter came in full blast Saturday morning the day after your arrival to Days of Ice and fire. 6 inches of heavy snow in some places. Winter has come indeed. I hope the weather didn't effect you to much. It can get pretty harsh up here in MN.

Hope your travel back to New Mexico was smooth and that its much warmer there then it is here.
comments.subject: I hope your Ubowed, Unbent and Unbroken from your trip to MN

comments.article:
I just finished the feast for crows for the 6th time and i just wanted to great you ( aouu i'm pretty sure i'm original) for these great adventures you brought us (please excuse my grammar and telling, but you have a lot of fans that are not speaking english fluently ,i'm sure of that too) And i wanted to tell you that (again, its very original) you have my full support for that tremendous task you have put on yourself, you are atlas building the world he has to carry on his shoulders ( yes its very stupid but that is what heroes are: very stupid and loved people)
Santé et bon courage!
comments.subject: From overseas and and overtime

comments.article: Sorry I missed you last night - had a minor emergency that came up just as I was leaving for the Har Mar Barns&Cows.  Hope you had a good flight home, and that you'll be back up here someday.

Sweet Seven! Coming from a fanatical follower of your work who couldn’t possibly be more anxious to witness Dragons Dance: Please, please, ple-e-e-ase, TAKE A DAY. Maybe a week! Rest. Watch football. Have some comfort food that you can only get at home.

That much travel can take it out of a person and we want you in top form when you get back in the ring with Kong! O}-< (That’s a, revitalized wordsmith flexes his muscles, emoticon.)
comments.subject: After so much travel...

comments.article: Days of Ice and Fire was a great time.  Thanks for coming out to MN.

Get plenty of rest, because you definitely deserve it. You've been traveling for the better part of the last three months right? If I was you I'd rest up for a week and watch my health and catch up on the G-men and the Jets. Then you'll be plenty well rested to start on the world of Westeros.

Remember to watch your health and to eat well! I usually get pretty sick after any big trip and you just traveled around the world for 3 months.

Santa Fe is probably not a bad place to be this time of year.  Hole up for the winter and emerge in the spring, just in time for the debut parties for GoT in Hollywood.  (I assume there will be debut parties for GoT in Hollywood.)

(I assume there will be debut parties for GoT in Hollywood.)

Dude, if not, there will definitely be a debut party here in Delaware!!
Welcome back and good luck on catching up for everything :)
Glad you had fun, glad you're home. Having pretty mild weather here in NM, so hopefully you can go all winter without getting sick again.
comments.subject: thank you!

comments.article: Welcome back to the desert, Mr. Martin. You're certainly one of New Mexico's favorite denizens!
comments.subject: Welcome!

comments.article:
It was great to see you again George.
Hope you are feeling better.

Finalmente!!!
(Finally - or in my mother tongue - "Konacno!!!"
comments.subject: He is at home

comments.upictitle: Some Guy Named Paul's Comix: Group
comments.article:
John Hodgman was talking up your books on Twitter last night, and I suggested that he would be excellent as the Tickler.

In a subsequent post, I spelled his name wrong and in discussing that I got an unexpected reply:

http://twitter.com/#!/hodgman/status/4764108687671296

"@hodgman: @sgnp @charles_star everything is fine. I would happily be your torturer."

So there you have it. I realize there are many applicable metaphors involving carts, horses, and chickens but I think his interest is pretty darn cool.
comments.subject: John Hodgman

comments.article: Yes, but how would George feel about the guy who plays a PC being cast in the series, given how many issues he's had with his computer in the past? I'd say cast Justin Long instead, but I don't think he's right for the part.
comments.subject: Re: John Hodgman

comments.article:
Hi George!

I just wanted to share a link to an article I wrote about a Song of Ice and Fire, and Game of Thrones. I know you're very busy catching up on life right now, but maybe you'll have time for this at some point.

http://bentthepodcast.com/television/game-of-thrones-changed-my-life/

Cheers,
Kelsey
comments.subject: Small ode to Martin and Game of thrones

comments.article: Welcome home. Hopefully this time you can stay there long enough to at least shake the dust from your feet.

...But you're down to the final stretch! I'm looking forward to the ANNOUNCEMENT we've all been waiting for!

:)
comments.subject: Final Stretch

comments.article: Welcome back to Westeros, please pull up a chair and stay awhile.
comments.subject: Home at last.

comments.article: Will you be gracing New York City with your presence anytime soon? We love you here, too, you know.
Good to see you back in Westeros!
